original: Cederberg, Daniel (Dan) Johan Waldemar, major, Halmstad, f. 5/12/ 84 i Karlskrona av gro’sshandl. Alfred’ C. o. Esther Rydström. G. 16 m. Tekla Norrlin. Barn: Karl-Gustaf f. 20, ing. — Stud:ex. i Karlskrona 04, off:-ex. 06. Und:löjtn. v. Hall. reg. 06, löjtn. 12, kapt. 21, major 34. Reg:-adjut. 15-19, signaloff. 14-21, brigad-signaloff. 17-26, chef f. Hall. reg. sig-nal-(spec.)komp. 21-34, reg:kvarter-mäst. 28-29, depåstabschef 40-41. Tjg. v. flottans istat :kont. i Karlskrona 09, 12 o. 14, SS 09, signaltjänst o. radio-utb. 12 o. 20, lär. v. första allm. land-st :kurs. i Sthlm 14, v. landstikurs i Halmstad 15, lär. å Karlberg v. utb:-kurser i signaltjänst f. off. 20 o. 22. Ordf. i Blek. gille, hed:led. av Sv:es filatel :fören. Halm-stadsavd. o. dess fd. ordf., ordf. i Halm^stads isim-säHsk., dess simlär. 13-19, ordf. i arb :utsk. f. bestyr, f. Sv. flaggans dag i Halmstad, led. av Sällsk. f. sv. kvartettsångens befrämj. o. dess omb. i Halmstad, juryman i vissa tryckfrih :mål v. råd-husr. i Halmstad. Skr.: Cederbergska Släkten fr. Röddinge, upps. o. avh. om simidr. i tidn. o. jub :skr., komp. Vikingarnas sång. RSO, Hall. idr:-förb. förtj:GM, Hall.-Nordv. Skånes landst:förb. förtj :SM, Sv. simförb. förtj:SM, Skytte- o. Mil. idr:Gm.
translated: Cederberg, Daniel (Dan) Johan Waldemar, Major, Halmstad, born on 5/12/84 in Karlskrona, son of the wholesale merchant Alfred C. and Esther Rydström. Married in 1916 to Tekla Norrlin with whom he had a son named Karl-Gustaf (born 1920), who became an engineer. He passed his student exam in Karlskrona in 1904 and his officer exam in 1906. He was a second lieutenant in the Halland Regiment in 1906, a lieutenant in 1912, a captain in 1921 and a major in 1934. He served as the regimental adjutant from 1915 to 1919, signal officer from 1914 to 1921, brigade signal officer from 1917 to 1926, commander of the Halland Regiment signal (special) company from 1921 to 1934, regimental quartermaster from 1928 to 1929, and depot staff chief from 1940 to 1941. He served in the Navy's ice surveying office in Karlskrona in 1909, 1912, and 1914, and in the Swedish Signal Service and radio training in 1912 and 1920 respectively. He taught the first general land course in Stockholm in 1914 and the county land course in Halmstad in 1915. He was a teacher at Karlberg for officer signal training courses in 1920 and 1922. He was the chairman of the Blekinge Guild, the honorary member of the Swedish philately association's Halmstad branch, chairman of the Halmstad swimming association, its swimming instructor from 1913 to 1919, chairman of the working committee for the management of the Swedish flag day in Halmstad, a member of the Society for the Promotion of Swedish Quartet Singing and its delegate in Halmstad, a jury member in certain freedom of the press cases in the Halmstad town hall. He wrote a genealogy and thesis regarding swimming in newspapers and jubilee publications and composed Vikingarna's Song. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Sword, the Halland Sports Federation's award Grand Master, the Halland-Northwest Skåne county sports federation's award of Merit, the Swedish Swimming Federation's award of merit, and the Shooting and Military Sports Federation's Grand Master.
